text: How does Julia for web dev compare to node js for hiding multi threading/asyncIO complexities?
Julia uses green threads, so it's more akin to Go in that regard than NodeJS/Python+asyncio. You don't have to litter your code with `async`/`await` to get concurrency.

text: We will use the same backend for querying IO tasks eventually as NodeJS - the io_uring in the newer linux kernels via libuv, but the PR hasn't been touched since late November and it's very hefty.

text: There's also a good chance our parallel scheduler gets way more efficient over time and will handle the compute heavy and light IO domains well with minimal tuning, but that's farther down the line.
